title: Inro and Netsuke
description: Inro, or portable medicine container, not of usual elongated shape, and no sections.  Round, wooden, seascape in flat gold lacquer (hiramakiye waves, boulder with bushes, birds) on both  sides.  Gold worn off along edges.  Netsuke, circular, of carved and pierced ivory.  Continuous scene, showing three men, one carrying umbrella, crossing a bridge over a stream to a house.  Three figures of metal, fitted into the ivory, to which piece end of cord is knotted.
